name: Lot Status
values: Awaiting Hold Point Release, Awaiting NCR Closure, Awaiting Test Results, Awaiting Verification, Cancelled, Closed-out, Outstanding, Work In Progress

name: Acceptance criteria - What is the lot size? Prepare a lot map for traceability of the work area
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Lot Map
Acceptance criteria - Has the work area been set out for line and level?
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist
Acceptance criteria - Has the material being excavated been inspected with category agreed upon by Superintendent?
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist
Acceptance criteria - Has the material to be used been approved by Client (Material certificates to be provided)?
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Where necessary, have batters been rounded and catch drains constructed to allow for potential surface runoff during the course of excavation?
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist
Acceptance criteria - The cuttings shall be so worked that the best material available, which in the opinion of the APA Representative is suitable material, shall be placed in embankments.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist

Acceptance criteria - The sides of cuttings shall be battered and trimmed to a clean and sharp profile, carried around bends in even curves all to lines and slopes as shown on the drawings provided or directed by the APA Representative.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist
Acceptance criteria - Unsuitable and sensitive materials such as silt and or organic matter shall be removed from subgrades to the extent directed by the APA Representative.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist

Acceptance criteria - When a sub‐grade is unable to support construction equipment, or it is not possible to compact overlying pavement, only because of sub‐grade moisture content, then one or more of the following optional actions may be taken:
a) Allow the sub‐grade to dry to a moisture content that will allow compaction and theplacement of pavement material;
b) Scarify the sub‐grade to a minimum depth of 150 mm and work as necessary to accelerate drying. Re‐compact as specified when moisture content approaches optimum;
c) Excavate the soft material and replace with compacted select fill material in accordance with Section 4.4 above.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist

Acceptance criteria - The sub‐grade shall be compacted to 98% relative dry density (standard compaction) to a depth of 150 mm. The frequency of testing to confirm this compaction shall be 1 test per 1 000 square metres
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
3.1 - Unsuitable Foundation Material Preparation of Natural Surface

Acceptance criteria - Where in the opinion of the APA Representative the material exposed after stripping on which embankments are to be constructed is unsuitable, such material shall be removed and replaced by approved fill material. Any soft or saturated areas shall be surface drained.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist
3.2 - Compaction of material below ground surface under embankments Preparation of Natural Surface

Acceptance criteria - The ground surface shall be compacted to 98% relative dry density (standard compaction) to a depth 150 mm below ground surface. The frequency of testing this compaction shall be at the rate of 1 test per 1 000 m2 of surface area.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
3.3 - Fill Material (Site won materials) Preparation of Natural Surface
Acceptance criteria - Only material approved by the APA Representative shall be used from cuttings in the construction of embankments. Generally the material used shall comply with the following:
Percentage passing 0.075mm || Not greater than 25% by weight
○ All materials used in embankments shall be to the approval of the APA Representative.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
3.4 - Fill Material (Imported materials) Preparation of Natural Surface
Acceptance criteria - Where imported fill material is required, it shall be approved by the APA Representative.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist
Acceptance criteria - Filling shall be carried out in uniform horizontal layers of not more than 200 mm of loose material and compacted as specified.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist
Acceptance criteria - The surface of the sub‐grade shall be compacted, trimmed, profiled and check levelled prior to placing of pavement materials. Design Level Tolerance +0 mm / ‐30 mm
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Survey Report

Acceptance criteria - Earthworks to fill for roadway embankment shall be compacted to 100% relative dry density (standard compaction) for the first 300 mm of embankment depth immediately below the required pavement. All other earthworks to fill as shown on drawings provided or specified shall be compacted to 98% relative dry density (standard compaction).
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Has the pavement been constructed at the correct width and alignment as detailed in the construction drawings?
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Checklist
Acceptance criteria - Has the prepared subgrade been surveyed in accordance with and verifying specified requirements?
○ Shape Tolerance of 25 mm maximum deviation from a 3 m straight edge laid in any direction.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
